intent_atoms.description: Add a dedicated Corruption section to the SwiftUI detail inspector that displays tolerant parsing issues with severity iconography, copy-friendly metadata, and VoiceOver-ready labels.
Implement ParseTreeDetailViewModel.focusIssue(on:) to jump the hex viewer to corruption ranges and update hex slice windowing to center on requested offsets.
The Corruption section must display severity iconography, copy-friendly metadata, and VoiceOver-ready labels for tolerant parsing issues.
Hex viewer navigation via focusIssue(on:) must correctly jump to corruption ranges and center the hex slice window on requested offsets.
Accessibility summaries must report corruption counts.
The system must always maintain a consistent state when accessing or updating the Corruption section.
Coordinate with T3.4 placeholder nodes to allow future linkages between the user‑tolerant parsing error …

functional_units.name: Corruption Section in SwiftUI Detail Inspector
functional_units.description: Displays corruption information with severity icons, copy-friendly metadata, and VoiceOver-ready labels when tolerant parsing issues occur.

functional_units.name: ParseTreeDetailViewModel.focusIssue(on:) Method
functional_units.description: Jumps the hex viewer to specified corruption ranges and centers the view on requested offsets.

functional_units.name: Hex Viewer Slice Windowing
functional_units.description: Adjusts the hex slice window size and centers it around requested offsets for navigation.

functional_units.name: Accessibility Summaries for Corruption Counts
functional_units.description: Provides accessibility summaries that report the number of corruption instances in the inspector.

functional_units.name: Hex Navigation Workflow
functional_units.description: Workflow enabling users to navigate through hex data, including jumping to specific corruption ranges.
